reviews.sentence: DO NOT STAY HERE. Nothing. The room was absolutely disgusting. Not clean found food wrappers in the bed. Showered in a foot of water as the drain did not work properly and sink did not drain water properly either. I went downstairs and complained and was offered a did not room. Still old gross and frightening. Had power points falling off the walls. There was crumbs on the floor and card board covering holes in the hallways. Read some reviews post check in and was scared for safety. Room was advertised as modern and renovated. Staff would not give discount. If I had of checked in earlier I would have demanded a refund and moved hotels. Never have a seen a more disgusting hotel. Was told it was a cheap room so I did not needs refund by staff. Others complained about the same things at check out also.

Close to downtown. let us start off with the room the room was decent nice furniture. However later on our first night the room was hot. I tried to turn the AC on and it was not working at all. I called the front desk to ask how to turn the AC on and they stated that the whole building was set up for the heater to be on. They offered me a fan and I accepted it. Yes I understand were in January but we are in California it is not even raining or cold outside. On top of that the hotel was under construction. We got woken up at 6 in the morning every morning. It was horrible. The only thing that I liked that we were close to downtown. However I would rather pay more for comfort than being close to downtown.

Inside of the room small but clean with no signs of damage. Only in the hallways and the elevator can one see some minor cracks and usage. Also the staff is very friendly and polite but even if you are a guest you still pay for the parking.

Fine for the basics. The room was newly renovated and had all the basics. My air conditioning broke on the second day the water was turned off right before check out time and no one let me know the phone did not work so I could not call the front desk. Most importantly though no chain lock on the door made me very uncomfortable.

Renovation works. We have stayed at the Mayfair hotel for 5nights. We arrived late so tried to find some food in one of the corner stores close by which were a disaster the neighbourhood is certainly not the best. It is in walkable distance to the convention centre. The renovation works are currently extensive and lifts took 10min to arrive due these works. The room itself was good the rest of the hotel requires a lick of paint especially the reception area. Certainly not a hotel to write home about. Decent value.

Epic Fail. Stayed here this past week and let me start by saying they are under a full scale renovation. I stayed in one of the newly renovated room which on the surface was not bad. The overall room size is not bad but the bathroom is ridiculously undersized. Housekeeping kept up on the room pretty well but the rest of the hotel was a mess. The area where the hotel is located is not the best several times during my stay I witnessed people come from off the street and use the ice machine and walk back out. The staff outside of one lady was completely rude and useless. I made several calls about marijuana being smoked in one of the rooms to the right and left of me and nothing was done. I watched the valet get into an actual physical altercation with a gentleman about the valet striking his window. On top of all that if you have a vehicle you have to valet it for 30 a night. Also you have to put down a 50 deposit for every night you stay which you will get back in 2 7 business days. The bed was nice. there is a mall about three blocks away it has a Target CPK and a Mortons Steakhouse. Pretty much everything.

Cute remodeled hotel that is going to rock when the remodel is finished. The rooms are very trendy and comfortable. I also liked the attention to detail like water at the entrance. Staff were always responsive to requests. Seems like maybe understaffed when it came to bellboys but then the other staff jumped in to take care of that so that was good. I guess eventually they will have a restaurant bar and pool and that is going to make it spectacular. The front of the building definitely needs a makeover. I know the area is kinda shady I have lived in LA enough to know this but the hotel really has some potential.

Small no extras. The Decour had potential. The furniture needed finishing touches like removing the stickers and pieces secured level. The room was very small with the Murphy bed that you could not close. 30 valet parking per night. No pool no fitness center no room service.
Hotel is in renovation not in good area service is low. Claimed in downtown but 2 blocks away from goods area. Feel not safe services is limited and not very welcome.
On a budget. staff willing to help clear notice on renovations and i m sure when its finished your be pleasantly surprisedstain on the carpets very dark corridors.
Construction aside great rooms and service. Staff was great room was clean and comfortable. Construction in the lobby no problem especially since the rooms were discounted.

Met All My Needs. I did not know what to expect from this hotel and I was impressed with their level of service the beauty of their property and the ease of checking in and out. I did not realize my car would be parked via valet. When I pulled up I thought it would be extra which it is but I had booked the room with parking included I assumed it was self parking but it is valet parkingThe attendants were cheerful friendly and eager to help. The front desk was friendly informative and patient with me since I had had a long drive and felt dazed. The room was gorgeous. It was not large but just your average sized room. However the decoration was beautiful. everyone was friendly and helpful from the valet and front desk to the housekeepers and janitors maintenance.
Very nice. The door greeting and front desk staff are awesome. Long cool bar too. Cool vibe here would definitely return.
Very small rooms. The staff very friendly and helpful.
Went there for the restaurant. Food was great along with service. Finding parking around the area was a bit tough had to settle for valet but with validation the cost of valet was cut in half.
Cool stay great bar staff. I liked the decor sound system is great. The room was smaller than I ’m used to but I hear it ’s a historic building. so likely a byproduct of age of building.

Art Deco style hotel with friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay at the Mayfair. We had great service and our room was a perfect fit for us family of four junior suite. Although it was aprox. a mile from downtown and the local area seemed to be in a less than ideal part of town we had no issues walking back and forth every day to get to great shopping and restaurants.

Potential to be a great LA Hotel. The Hotel is 1920 ’s glamour on the face very pleasant however it is let down by construction workers and staff filling elevators perhaps designate a staff elevator. Some noise from them too. The rooms were dusty. The sheets on the beds are Polyester. For a 4 star hotel this is a no no. Polyester makes you perspire and they are uncomfortable 4 star hotels should use pure cotton minimum 80 point. The pool and terrace were still under construction which was disappointing. The public areas such as elevators were dusty and were often spoiled by construction debris. The Art collection is impressive the bar staff pleasant. But it is the details that make a great hotel. The Mayfair has the Potential to be a great LA hotel.
Boutique Hotel with exquisite foyer. Great hotel beautiful architecture features lovely foyer friendly service fast check in. Room small and tiny bathroom for standard queen room. Great location.

Really great place I loved everything about this hotel. Great artwork and nice staff. Good happy hour. Tons of great areas in the lobby for a cozy quick bite and a drink with friends or a date. The views were not good from my room and the noise from them building woke me up. I am sure it is temporary and I would not let that keep me that from staying here again. It is supposed to be haunted I did not see a ghost and slept soundly until the construction next door. I love historical buildings and it was a treat to stay here.
